Ancestral Healing.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
Ancestral Healing.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

Animal Companion.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

Arcane Explosion.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
Arcane Explosion.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

Arcane Intellect.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

Arcane Missiles.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Arcane Missiles.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

Arcane Shot.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

Arcanite Reaper.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

Archmage.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

Assassin's Blade.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

Assassinate.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

Backstab.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
Backstab.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

Blessing of Kings.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

Blessing of Might.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

Bloodlust.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.

Bluegill Warrior.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

Booty Bay Bodyguard.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

Boulderfist Ogre.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

Charge.text: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
Charge.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

Chillwind Yeti.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

Claw.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
Claw.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

Cleave.text: Deal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
Cleave.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

Consecration.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

Core Hound.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

Corruption.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
Corruption.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM!  Corrupted!

Dalaran Mage.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

Darkscale Healer.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
Darkscale Healer.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

Deadly Poison.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

Divine Spirit.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

Dragonling Mechanic.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

Drain Life.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
Drain Life.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

Dread Infernal.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
Dread Infernal.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

Elven Archer.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

Fan of Knives.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
Fan of Knives.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

Fiery War Axe.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

Fire Elemental.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

Fireball.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

Flamestrike.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
Flamestrike.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

Flametongue Totem.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

Frost Nova.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

Frost Shock.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.

Frostbolt.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
Frostbolt.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

Frostwolf Grunt.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

Frostwolf Warlord.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
Frostwolf Warlord.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

Gnomish Inventor.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

Goldshire Footman.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

Grimscale Oracle.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

Guardian of Kings.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

Gurubashi Berserker.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

Hammer of Wrath.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

Hand of Protection.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

Hellfire.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

Heroic Strike.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
Heroic Strike.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

Hex.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
Hex.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

Holy Light.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

Holy Nova.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
Holy Nova.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

Holy Smite.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

Houndmaster.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

Humility.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

Hunter's Mark.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

Innervate.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
Innervate.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

Kill Command.text: Deal $3 damage. If you have a Beast, deal $5 damage instead.

Kobold Geomancer.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

Kor'kron Elite.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

Light's Justice.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

Lord of the Arena.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

Magma Rager.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

Mark of the Wild.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
Mark of the Wild.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

Mind Blast.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
Mind Blast.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

Mind Control.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
Mind Control.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

Mind Vision.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
Mind Vision.flavor: I see what you did there.

Mirror Image.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

Moonfire.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

Mortal Coil.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
Mortal Coil.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

Multi-Shot.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.

Murloc Raider.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

Nightblade.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

Northshire Cleric.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
Northshire Cleric.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

Novice Engineer.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

Oasis Snapjaw.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

Ogre Magi.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

Polymorph.text: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
Polymorph.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

Power Word: Shield.text:
Give a minion +2 Health.
Draw a card.
Power Word: Shield.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

Razorfen Hunter.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

Reckless Rocketeer.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

River Crocolisk.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

Rockbiter Weapon.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
Rockbiter Weapon.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

Sacrificial Pact.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
Sacrificial Pact.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

Sap.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.

Savage Roar.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
Savage Roar.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

Sen'jin Shieldmasta.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

Shadow Bolt.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   Its made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

Shadow Word: Death.text: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 5 or more.
Shadow Word: Death.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

Shadow Word: Pain.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
Shadow Word: Pain.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

Shattered Sun Cleric.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

Shield Block.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

Silverback Patriarch.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

Sinister Strike.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.
Sinister Strike.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

Soulfire.text: Deal $4 damage. Discard a random card.
Soulfire.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

Starfire.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

Starving Buzzard.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
Starving Buzzard.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

Stormpike Commando.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

Stormwind Champion.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

Stormwind Knight.flavor: They're still embarassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

Swipe.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
Swipe.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

Timber Wolf.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

Tracking.text: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
Tracking.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

Truesilver Champion.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
Truesilver Champion.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

Tundra Rhino.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

Vanish.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

Voidwalker.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

Voodoo Doctor.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

War Golem.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

Warsong Commander.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

Water Elemental.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
Water Elemental.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

Whirlwind.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

Wild Growth.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

Windfury.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Windspeaker.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

Wolfrider.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

Axe Flinger.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
Axe Flinger.flavor: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".
Axe Flinger.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Axe Flinger.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Warrior Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Blackwing Corruptor.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage.
Blackwing Corruptor.flavor: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.
Blackwing Corruptor.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackwing Corruptor.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Maloriak in the Hidden Laboratory.

Blackwing Technician.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1/+1.
Blackwing Technician.flavor: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!
Blackwing Technician.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackwing Technician.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Baron Geddon in Molten Core.

Chromaggus.text: Whenever you draw a card, put another copy into your hand.
Chromaggus.flavor: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.
Chromaggus.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Chromaggus.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing Blackwing Lair.

Core Rager.text: Battlecry: If your hand is empty, gain +3/+3.
Core Rager.flavor: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.
Core Rager.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Core Rager.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Highlord Omokk in Blackrock Spire.

Dark Iron Skulker.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
Dark Iron Skulker.flavor: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.
Dark Iron Skulker.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Dark Iron Skulker.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Rogue Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Demonwrath.text: Deal $2 damage to all non-Demon minions.
Demonwrath.flavor: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.
Demonwrath.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Demonwrath.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Warlock Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Dragon Consort.text: Battlecry: The next Dragon you play costs (2) less.
Dragon Consort.flavor: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.
Dragon Consort.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Dragon Consort.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating General Drakkisath in Blackrock Spire.

Dragon Egg.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/1 Whelp.
Dragon Egg.flavor: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.
Dragon Egg.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Dragon Egg.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Rend Blackhand in Blackrock Spire.

Dragon's Breath.text: Deal $4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
Dragon's Breath.flavor: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.
Dragon's Breath.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Dragon's Breath.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Mage Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Dragonkin Sorcerer.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
Dragonkin Sorcerer.flavor: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".
Dragonkin Sorcerer.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Dragonkin Sorcerer.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Nefarian in the Hidden Laboratory.

Drakonid Crusher.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3.
Drakonid Crusher.flavor: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humaniod. But, like, why?
Drakonid Crusher.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Drakonid Crusher.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Atramedes in the Hidden Laboratory.

Druid of the Flame.text: Choose One - Transform into a 5/2 minion; or a 2/5 minion.
Druid of the Flame.flavor: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.
Druid of the Flame.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Druid of the Flame.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Garr in Molten Core.

Emperor Thaurissan.text: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
Emperor Thaurissan.flavor: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.
Emperor Thaurissan.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Emperor Thaurissan.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing Blackrock Depths.

Fireguard Destroyer.flavor: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.
Fireguard Destroyer.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Fireguard Destroyer.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Lord Victor Nefarius in Blackwing Lair.

Flamewaker.text: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Flamewaker.flavor: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.
Flamewaker.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Flamewaker.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Vaelastrasz in Blackwing Lair.

Gang Up.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.
Gang Up.flavor: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.
Gang Up.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Gang Up.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating the Dark Iron Arena in Blackrock Depths.

Grim Patron.text: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
Grim Patron.flavor: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!
Grim Patron.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Grim Patron.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating The Grim Guzzler in Blackrock Depths.

Hungry Dragon.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for your opponent.
Hungry Dragon.flavor: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.
Hungry Dragon.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Hungry Dragon.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Chromaggus in Blackwing Lair.

Imp Gang Boss.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.
Imp Gang Boss.flavor: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.
Imp Gang Boss.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Imp Gang Boss.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Majordomo Executus in Molten Core.

Lava Shock.text: Deal $2 damage. Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
Lava Shock.flavor: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.
Lava Shock.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Lava Shock.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Shaman Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Majordomo Executus.text: Deathrattle: Replace your hero with Ragnaros, the Firelord.
Majordomo Executus.flavor: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.
Majordomo Executus.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Majordomo Executus.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing Molten Core.

Nefarian.text: Battlecry: Add 2 random spells to your hand (from your opponent's class).
Nefarian.flavor: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.
Nefarian.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Nefarian.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Hidden Laboratory.

Quick Shot.text:
Deal $3 damage.
If your hand is empty, draw a card.
Quick Shot.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Quick Shot.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Hunter Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Rend Blackhand.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.
Rend Blackhand.flavor: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.
Rend Blackhand.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Rend Blackhand.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing Blackrock Spire.

Resurrect.text: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
Resurrect.flavor: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"
Resurrect.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Resurrect.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Emperor Thaurissan in Blackrock Depths.

Revenge.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $3 damage instead.
Revenge.flavor: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.
Revenge.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Revenge.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Razorgore in Blackwing Lair.

Solemn Vigil.text: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
Solemn Vigil.flavor: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.
Solemn Vigil.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Solemn Vigil.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Paladin Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Twilight Whelp.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.
Twilight Whelp.flavor: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.
Twilight Whelp.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Twilight Whelp.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Priest Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Volcanic Drake.text: Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
Volcanic Drake.flavor: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.
Volcanic Drake.howToGet: Unlocked in Hidden Laboratory, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Volcanic Drake.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Omnotron Defense System in the Hidden Laboratory.

Volcanic Lumberer.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
Volcanic Lumberer.flavor: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!
Volcanic Lumberer.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Spire, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Volcanic Lumberer.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Druid Class Challenge in Blackrock Mountain.

Abomination.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

Abusive Sergeant.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
Abusive Sergeant.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

Acolyte of Pain.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
Acolyte of Pain.flavor: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

Al'Akir the Windlord.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

Alarm-o-Bot.text: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand.

Aldor Peacekeeper.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
Aldor Peacekeeper.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

Alexstrasza.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
Alexstrasza.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

Amani Berserker.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

Ancestral Spirit.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
Ancestral Spirit.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.

Ancient Brewmaster.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
Ancient Brewmaster.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.

Ancient Mage.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

Ancient of Lore.text: Choose One - Draw 2 cards; or Restore 5 Health.
Ancient of Lore.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

Ancient of War.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

Ancient Watcher.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

Angry Chicken.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

Arathi Weaponsmith.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

Arcane Golem.text: Charge. Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
Arcane Golem.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

Archmage Antonidas.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
Archmage Antonidas.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

Argent Commander.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

Argent Protector.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

Argent Squire.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

Armorsmith.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
Armorsmith.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

Auchenai Soulpriest.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
Auchenai Soulpriest.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

Avenging Wrath.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Avenging Wrath.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

Azure Drake.flavor: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

Bane of Doom.text: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
Bane of Doom.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

Baron Geddon.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
Baron Geddon.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

Battle Rage.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
Battle Rage.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

Bestial Wrath.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
Bestial Wrath.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

Betrayal.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
Betrayal.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

Big Game Hunter.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
Big Game Hunter.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

Bite.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn and 4 Armor.

Blade Flurry.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemies.
Blade Flurry.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

Blessed Champion.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

Blessing of Wisdom.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
Blessing of Wisdom.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

Blizzard.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
Blizzard.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.

Blood Imp.text: Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
Blood Imp.flavor: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

Blood Knight.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
Blood Knight.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

Bloodmage Thalnos.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

Bloodsail Corsair.text: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
Bloodsail Corsair.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

Bloodsail Raider.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
Bloodsail Raider.flavor: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

Brawl.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
Brawl.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

Cabal Shadow Priest.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
Cabal Shadow Priest.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

Cairne Bloodhoof.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

Captain Greenskin.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

Cenarius.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
Cenarius.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

Cold Blood.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
Cold Blood.flavor: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

Coldlight Oracle.flavor: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.

Coldlight Seer.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

Commanding Shout.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
Commanding Shout.flavor: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

Conceal.text: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
Conceal.flavor: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

Cone of Cold.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
Cone of Cold.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

Counterspell.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
Counterspell.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

Crazed Alchemist.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
Crazed Alchemist.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

Cruel Taskmaster.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
Cruel Taskmaster.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

Cult Master.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
Cult Master.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

Dark Iron Dwarf.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
Dark Iron Dwarf.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

Deadly Shot.flavor: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

Deathwing.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
Deathwing.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

Defender of Argus.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

Defias Ringleader.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

Demolisher.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
Demolisher.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

Demonfire.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
Demonfire.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

Dire Wolf Alpha.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

Divine Favor.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
Divine Favor.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

Doomguard.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

Doomhammer.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

Doomsayer.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
Doomsayer.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

Dread Corsair.text: Taunt. Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
Dread Corsair.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

Druid of the Claw.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

Dust Devil.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

Eaglehorn Bow.text: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
Eaglehorn Bow.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

Earth Shock.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
Earth Shock.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

Earthen Ring Farseer.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

Edwin VanCleef.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
Edwin VanCleef.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

Emperor Cobra.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
Emperor Cobra.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

Equality.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
Equality.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

Ethereal Arcanist.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
Ethereal Arcanist.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

Eviscerate.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

Explosive Shot.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
Explosive Shot.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

Explosive Trap.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
Explosive Trap.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

Eye for an Eye.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
Eye for an Eye.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

Faceless Manipulator.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
Faceless Manipulator.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

Faerie Dragon.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Faerie Dragon.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

Far Sight.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
Far Sight.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

Felguard.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
Felguard.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

Fen Creeper.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

Feral Spirit.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

Flame Imp.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

Flare.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
Flare.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

Flesheating Ghoul.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
Flesheating Ghoul.flavor: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name.  It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

Force of Nature.text: Summon three 2/2 Treants with Charge that die at the end of the turn.
Force of Nature.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

Forked Lightning.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
Forked Lightning.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

Freezing Trap.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more.
Freezing Trap.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

Frost Elemental.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

Frothing Berserker.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
Frothing Berserker.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

Gadgetzan Auctioneer.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
Gadgetzan Auctioneer.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

Gladiator's Longbow.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

Gorehowl.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
Gorehowl.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

Grommash Hellscream.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

Gruul.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
Gruul.flavor: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

Harrison Jones.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
Harrison Jones.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

Harvest Golem.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

Headcrack.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
Headcrack.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

Hogger.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
Hogger.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

Holy Fire.text: Deal $5 damage. Restore #5 Health to your hero.

Holy Wrath.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost.

Ice Barrier.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
Ice Barrier.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

Ice Block.text: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
Ice Block.flavor: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

Ice Lance.text: Freeze a character. If it was already Frozen, deal $4 damage instead.
Ice Lance.flavor: The trick is not to break the lance.  Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces."  Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

Illidan Stormrage.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
Illidan Stormrage.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

Imp Master.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp.
Imp Master.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

Injured Blademaster.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

Inner Fire.text: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
Inner Fire.flavor: Good idea: Buffing your minions.  Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

Inner Rage.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
Inner Rage.flavor: They're only smiling on the outside.

Ironbeak Owl.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

Jungle Panther.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

Keeper of the Grove.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
Keeper of the Grove.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

Kidnapper.text: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
Kidnapper.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

King Krush.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

King Mukla.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

Kirin Tor Mage.text: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
Kirin Tor Mage.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

Knife Juggler.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
Knife Juggler.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

Lava Burst.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

Leeroy Jenkins.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
Leeroy Jenkins.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.

Leper Gnome.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
Leper Gnome.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

Lightning Bolt.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

Lightning Storm.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
Lightning Storm.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

Lightspawn.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
Lightspawn.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

Lightwarden.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
Lightwarden.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

Lightwell.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
Lightwell.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

Lord Jaraxxus.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
Lord Jaraxxus.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

Lorewalker Cho.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
Lorewalker Cho.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

Mad Bomber.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
Mad Bomber.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

Malygos.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

Mana Addict.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
Mana Addict.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

Mana Tide Totem.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
Mana Tide Totem.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

Mana Wraith.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

Mana Wyrm.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
Mana Wyrm.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

Mark of Nature.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
Mark of Nature.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

Mass Dispel.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
Mass Dispel.flavor: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

Master of Disguise.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

Master Swordsmith.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
Master Swordsmith.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

Mind Control Tech.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
Mind Control Tech.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

Mindgames.text: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
Mindgames.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

Mirror Entity.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
Mirror Entity.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

Misdirection.text: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
Misdirection.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

Mogu'shan Warden.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

Molten Giant.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
Molten Giant.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

Mortal Strike.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
Mortal Strike.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

Mountain Giant.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
Mountain Giant.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.

Murloc Tidecaller.text: Whenever a Murloc is summoned, gain +1 Attack.
Murloc Tidecaller.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

Murloc Warleader.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

Nat Pagle.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
Nat Pagle.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

Naturalize.text: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.

Noble Sacrifice.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.

Nourish.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
Nourish.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

Nozdormu.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
Nozdormu.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.

Onyxia.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
Onyxia.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

Patient Assassin.text: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
Patient Assassin.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

Perdition's Blade.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

Pint-Sized Summoner.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
Pint-Sized Summoner.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

Pit Lord.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

Power of the Wild.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
Power of the Wild.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

Power Overwhelming.text: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
Power Overwhelming.flavor: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

Preparation.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.

Priestess of Elune.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

Prophet Velen.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
Prophet Velen.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

Pyroblast.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

Questing Adventurer.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
Questing Adventurer.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

Raging Worgen.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

Ragnaros the Firelord.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
Ragnaros the Firelord.flavor: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

Ravenholdt Assassin.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

Redemption.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
Redemption.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

Repentance.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
Repentance.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

Savagery.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
Savagery.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

Savannah Highmane.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

Scarlet Crusader.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

Scavenging Hyena.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
Scavenging Hyena.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

Sea Giant.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.

Secretkeeper.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

Sense Demons.text: Put 2 random Demons from your deck into your hand.
Sense Demons.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

Shadow Madness.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
Shadow Madness.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

Shadowflame.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
Shadowflame.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

Shadowform.text: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
Shadowform.flavor: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

Shadowstep.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
Shadowstep.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

Shield Slam.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
Shield Slam.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

Shieldbearer.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

SI:7 Agent.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

Silence.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

Silver Hand Knight.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

Silvermoon Guardian.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

Siphon Soul.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
Siphon Soul.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

Slam.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
Slam.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

Snake Trap.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
Snake Trap.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

Snipe.text: Secret: When your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
Snipe.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

Sorcerer's Apprentice.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

Soul of the Forest.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."

Southsea Captain.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

Southsea Deckhand.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
Southsea Deckhand.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

Spellbender.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
Spellbender.flavor: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild.  It just feels meaner.  And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

Spellbreaker.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

Spiteful Smith.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

Stampeding Kodo.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
Stampeding Kodo.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

Starfall.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
Starfall.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

Stranglethorn Tiger.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

Summoning Portal.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
Summoning Portal.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

Sunfury Protector.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

Sunwalker.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

Sword of Justice.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
Sword of Justice.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

Sylvanas Windrunner.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
Sylvanas Windrunner.flavor: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

Tauren Warrior.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

Temple Enforcer.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

The Beast.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
The Beast.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

The Black Knight.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

Thoughtsteal.text: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand.
Thoughtsteal.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

Thrallmar Farseer.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

Tinkmaster Overspark.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
Tinkmaster Overspark.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

Tirion Fordring.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

Twilight Drake.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
Twilight Drake.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

Twisting Nether.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

Unbound Elemental.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.
Unbound Elemental.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

Unleash the Hounds.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
Unleash the Hounds.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

Upgrade!.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.

Vaporize.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
Vaporize.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

Venture Co. Mercenary.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

Violet Teacher.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
Violet Teacher.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

Void Terror.text: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health.
Void Terror.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

Wild Pyromancer.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
Wild Pyromancer.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

Windfury Harpy.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

Wisp.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

Worgen Infiltrator.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

Wrath.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
Wrath.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

Young Dragonhawk.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

Young Priestess.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
Young Priestess.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

Youthful Brewmaster.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
Youthful Brewmaster.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

Ysera.text: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.
Ysera.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

Anub'ar Ambusher.text: Deathrattle: Return a random friendly minion to your hand.
Anub'ar Ambusher.flavor: Originally he was called "Anub'ar Guy who bounces a guy back to your hand", but it lacked a certain zing.
Anub'ar Ambusher.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Anub'ar Ambusher.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Rogue Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Avenge.text: Secret: When one of your minions dies, give a random friendly minion +3/+2.
Avenge.flavor: Several paladins have joined together to deliver justice under the name "Justice Force".  Their lawyer talked them out of calling themselves the Justice League.
Avenge.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Avenge.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Paladin Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Baron Rivendare.flavor: There used to be five Horsemen but one of them left because a job opened up in the deadmines and the benefits were better.
Baron Rivendare.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Baron Rivendare.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Military Quarter.

Dancing Swords.flavor: They like to dance to reggae.
Dancing Swords.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Dancing Swords.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Instructor Razuvious in the Military Quarter.

Dark Cultist.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3 Health.
Dark Cultist.flavor: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.
Dark Cultist.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Dark Cultist.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Priest Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Death's Bite.flavor: "Take a bite outta Death." - McScruff the Deathlord
Death's Bite.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Death's Bite.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Warrior Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Deathlord.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Your opponent puts a minion from their deck into the battlefield.
Deathlord.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Deathlord.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating The Four Horsemen in the Military Quarter.

Duplicate.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, put 2 copies of it into your hand.
Duplicate.flavor: The one time when duping cards won't get your account banned!
Duplicate.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Duplicate.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Mage Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Echoing Ooze.text: Battlecry: Summon an exact copy of this minion at the end of the turn.
Echoing Ooze.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Echoing Ooze.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Sapphiron in the Frostwyrm Lair.

Feugen.text: Deathrattle: If Stalagg also died this game, summon Thaddius.
Feugen.flavor: Feugen is sad because everyone likes Stalagg better.
Feugen.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Feugen.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Construct Quarter.

Haunted Creeper.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Haunted Creeper.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Anub'Rekhan in the Arachnid Quarter.

Kel'Thuzad.text: At the end of each turn, summon all friendly minions that died this turn.
Kel'Thuzad.flavor: Kel'Thuzad could not resist the call of the Lich King. Even when it's just a robo-call extolling the Lich King's virtues.
Kel'Thuzad.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Kel'Thuzad.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating every boss in Naxxramas!

Loatheb.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.
Loatheb.flavor: Loatheb used to be a simple Bog Beast.  This is why we need stricter regulations on mining and agriculture.
Loatheb.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Loatheb.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Plague Quarter.

Mad Scientist.text: Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
Mad Scientist.flavor: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.
Mad Scientist.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Mad Scientist.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Grobbulus in the Construct Quarter.

Maexxna.text: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
Maexxna.flavor: Maexxna gets super mad when people introduce her as "Maxina" or "Maxxy".
Maexxna.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Maexxna.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Arachnid Quarter.

Nerub'ar Weblord.flavor: Weblords spend all day making giant trampoline parks.
Nerub'ar Weblord.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Nerub'ar Weblord.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Grand Widow Faerlina in the Arachnid Quarter.

Nerubian Egg.flavor: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.
Nerubian Egg.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Nerubian Egg.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Maexxna in the Arachnid Quarter.

Poison Seeds.text: Destroy all minions and summon 2/2 Treants to replace them.
Poison Seeds.flavor: "Poisonseed Bagel" is the least popular bagel at McTiggin's Druidic Bagel Emporium.
Poison Seeds.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Poison Seeds.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Druid Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Reincarnate.text: Destroy a minion, then return it to life with full Health.
Reincarnate.flavor: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.
Reincarnate.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Reincarnate.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Shaman Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Shade of Naxxramas.text: Stealth. At the start of your turn, gain +1/+1.
Shade of Naxxramas.flavor: The Shades of Naxxramas hate the living. They even have a slur they use to refer them: Livers.
Shade of Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Shade of Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Kel'Thuzad in the Frostwyrm Lair.

Sludge Belcher.flavor: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.
Sludge Belcher.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Sludge Belcher.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Loatheb in the Plague Quarter.

Spectral Knight.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Spectral Knight.flavor: What do Faerie Dragons and Spectral Knights have in common?  They both love pasta!
Spectral Knight.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Spectral Knight.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Gothik the Harvester in the Military Quarter.

Stalagg.text: Deathrattle: If Feugen also died this game, summon Thaddius.
Stalagg.flavor: Stalagg want to write own flavor text.  "STALAGG AWESOME!"
Stalagg.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Stalagg.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Construct Quarter.

Stoneskin Gargoyle.text: At the start of your turn, restore this minion to full Health.
Stoneskin Gargoyle.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Stoneskin Gargoyle.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Noth the Plaguebringer in the Plague Quarter.

Undertaker.text: Whenever you summon a minion with Deathrattle, gain +1 Attack.
Undertaker.flavor: In a world where you can run to a spirit healer and resurrect yourself, Undertakers do pretty light business.
Undertaker.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Undertaker.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Patchwerk in the Construct Quarter.

Unstable Ghoul.flavor: Filling your Ghouls with Rocket Fuel is all the rage at Necromancer school.
Unstable Ghoul.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Unstable Ghoul.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Heigan the Unclean in the Plague Quarter.

Voidcaller.text: Deathrattle: Put a random Demon from your hand into the battlefield.
Voidcaller.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Voidcaller.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Warlock Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Wailing Soul.flavor: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.
Wailing Soul.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Wailing Soul.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Thaddius in the Construct Quarter.

Webspinner.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Beast card to your hand.
Webspinner.flavor: Spider cocoons are like little piñatas!
Webspinner.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Webspinner.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after completing the Hunter Class Challenge in Naxxramas.

Zombie Chow.text: Deathrattle: Restore 5 Health to the enemy hero.
Zombie Chow.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Zombie Chow.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after defeating Gluth in the Construct Quarter.

Ancestor's Call.text: Put a random minion from each player's hand into the battlefield.

Anima Golem.text: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
Anima Golem.flavor: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

Annoy-o-Tron.flavor: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

Anodized Robo Cub.flavor: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

Antique Healbot.flavor: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

Arcane Nullifier X-21.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Arcane Nullifier X-21.flavor: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.

Blingtron 3000.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
Blingtron 3000.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

Bolvar Fordragon.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
Bolvar Fordragon.flavor: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

Bomb Lobber.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
Bomb Lobber.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

Bouncing Blade.text: Deal $1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.
Bouncing Blade.flavor: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

Burly Rockjaw Trogg.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
Burly Rockjaw Trogg.flavor: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

Call Pet.text:
Draw a card.
If it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.

Clockwork Giant.text: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.
Clockwork Giant.flavor: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

Clockwork Gnome.text: Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
Clockwork Gnome.flavor: Clockwork gnomes are always asking what time it is.

Cobalt Guardian.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.
Cobalt Guardian.flavor: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.

Cobra Shot.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
Cobra Shot.flavor: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

Coghammer.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield and Taunt.
Coghammer.flavor: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.

Cogmaster.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
Cogmaster.flavor: After a while, you don't see the cogs and sprockets. All you see is a robot, a spider tank, a deathray...

Cogmaster's Wrench.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
Cogmaster's Wrench.flavor: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!

Crush.text: Destroy a minion. If you have a damaged minion, this costs (4) less.
Crush.flavor: Using this card on your enemies is one of the best things in life, according to some barbarians.

Dark Wispers.text: Choose One - Summon 5 Wisps; or Give a minion +5/+5 and Taunt.
Dark Wispers.flavor: Don't worry; we fired the person who named this card.

Darkbomb.flavor: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

Demonheart.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion.  If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.
Demonheart.flavor: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.

Dr. Boom.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.

Druid of the Fang.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.
Druid of the Fang.flavor: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

Dunemaul Shaman.text: Windfury, Overload: (1) 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
Dunemaul Shaman.flavor: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!

Echo of Medivh.text: Put a copy of each friendly minion into your hand.
Echo of Medivh.flavor: Medivh's echo haunts Karazhan, eternally cheating at chess and Hearthstone.

Enhance-o Mechano.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield. (at random)

Explosive Sheep.flavor: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

Feign Death.flavor: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

Fel Cannon.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
Fel Cannon.flavor: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

Fel Reaver.text: Whenever your opponent plays a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.

Flame Leviathan.text: When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters.
Flame Leviathan.flavor: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

Flamecannon.text: Deal $4 damage to a random enemy minion.
Flamecannon.flavor: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

Floating Watcher.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
Floating Watcher.flavor: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

Flying Machine.flavor: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”

Foe Reaper 4000.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.
Foe Reaper 4000.flavor: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

Force-Tank MAX.flavor: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

Gahz'rilla.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
Gahz'rilla.flavor: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

Gazlowe.text: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
Gazlowe.flavor: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

Gilblin Stalker.flavor:
"Shhh, I think I hear something."
"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

Glaivezooka.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
Glaivezooka.flavor: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

Gnomeregan Infantry.flavor: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!

Gnomish Experimenter.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
Gnomish Experimenter.flavor: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

Goblin Auto-Barber.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

Goblin Blastmage.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, deal 4 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Goblin Blastmage.flavor: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

Goblin Sapper.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
Goblin Sapper.flavor: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

Grove Tender.text: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.
Grove Tender.flavor: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

Hemet Nesingwary.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

Hobgoblin.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.
Hobgoblin.flavor: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits.  First on the list: dental plan.
