Illuminator.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
Illuminator.flavor: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

Imp-losion.text: Deal $2-$4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.
Imp-losion.flavor: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.

Iron Juggernaut.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
Iron Juggernaut.flavor: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

Iron Sensei.text: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.
Iron Sensei.flavor:
Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language.
0110100001101001

Jeeves.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.
Jeeves.flavor: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

Junkbot.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.
Junkbot.flavor: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

Kezan Mystic.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.
Kezan Mystic.flavor: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

King of Beasts.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.
King of Beasts.flavor: He never sleeps.  Not even in the mighty jungle.

Light of the Naaru.text: Restore #3 Health. If the target is still damaged, summon a Lightwarden.
Light of the Naaru.flavor: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.

Lightbomb.text: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
Lightbomb.flavor: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

Lil' Exorcist.flavor: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

Lost Tallstrider.flavor: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

Madder Bomber.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.

Mal'Ganis.text: Your other Demons have +2/+2. Your hero is Immune.
Mal'Ganis.flavor: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

Malorne.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your deck.
Malorne.flavor: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

Mech-Bear-Cat.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, add a Spare Part card to your hand.
Mech-Bear-Cat.flavor: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

Mechanical Yeti.flavor: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

Mechwarper.flavor: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

Mekgineer Thermaplugg.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
Mekgineer Thermaplugg.flavor: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

Metaltooth Leaper.flavor: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

Micro Machine.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
Micro Machine.flavor: This card is the real thing.

Mimiron's Head.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
Mimiron's Head.flavor: Do not push the big red button!

Mini-Mage.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

Mistress of Pain.text: Whenever this minion deals damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
Mistress of Pain.flavor: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

Mogor the Ogre.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
Mogor the Ogre.flavor: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

Muster for Battle.text: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.
Muster for Battle.flavor: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

Neptulon.text: Battlecry: Add 4 random Murlocs to your hand. Overload: (3)
Neptulon.flavor: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

Ogre Brute.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
Ogre Brute.flavor: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

Ogre Ninja.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
Ogre Ninja.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

Ogre Warmaul.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
Ogre Warmaul.flavor: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.

One-eyed Cheat.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.
One-eyed Cheat.flavor: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

Piloted Shredder.flavor: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

Piloted Sky Golem.flavor: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

Powermace.flavor: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."

Puddlestomper.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

Quartermaster.flavor: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

Recombobulator.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
Recombobulator.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

Recycle.text: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
Recycle.flavor: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

Sabotage.text: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.
Sabotage.flavor: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

Salty Dog.flavor: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

Scarlet Purifier.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
Scarlet Purifier.flavor: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

Screwjank Clunker.flavor: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

Seal of Light.text: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
Seal of Light.flavor: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

Shadowbomber.flavor: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

Shadowboxer.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
Shadowboxer.flavor: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

Shielded Minibot.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

Shieldmaiden.flavor: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

Ship's Cannon.text: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
Ship's Cannon.flavor: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

Shrinkmeister.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -2 Attack this turn.
Shrinkmeister.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

Siege Engine.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.

Siltfin Spiritwalker.text: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)
Siltfin Spiritwalker.flavor: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"

Sneed's Old Shredder.flavor: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

Snowchugger.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
Snowchugger.flavor: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

Soot Spewer.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

Spider Tank.flavor: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

Steamwheedle Sniper.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.
Steamwheedle Sniper.flavor: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

Stonesplinter Trogg.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
Stonesplinter Trogg.flavor: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

Target Dummy.flavor: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.

Tinker's Sharpsword Oil.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
Tinker's Sharpsword Oil.flavor: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

Tinkertown Technician.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
Tinkertown Technician.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

Toshley.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.

Trade Prince Gallywix.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
Trade Prince Gallywix.flavor: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

Tree of Life.text: Restore all characters to full Health.

Troggzor the Earthinator.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
Troggzor the Earthinator.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

Unstable Portal.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
Unstable Portal.flavor: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals.  We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

Upgraded Repair Bot.flavor: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

Velen's Chosen.flavor: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"

Vitality Totem.text: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
Vitality Totem.flavor: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

Vol'jin.flavor: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

Warbot.flavor: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."

Wee Spellstopper.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Wee Spellstopper.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

Whirling Zap-o-matic.flavor: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."

Ancient Shade.text: Battlecry: Shuffle an 'Ancient Curse' into your deck that deals 7 damage to you when drawn.
Ancient Shade.flavor: Warning: Do not expose to direct sunlight.
Ancient Shade.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
Ancient Shade.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

Animated Armor.text: Your hero can only take 1 damage at a time.
Animated Armor.flavor: Try putting it on.  Wait, let me get my camera.
Animated Armor.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
Animated Armor.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

Anubisath Sentinel.flavor: He's actually a 1/1 who picked up the hammer from the last guy.

Anubisath Sentinel.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

Anyfin Can Happen.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

Bash.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.

Bear Trap.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.
Bear Trap.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

Beneath the Grounds.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
Beneath the Grounds.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

Bolf Ramshield.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
Bolf Ramshield.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

Bolster.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.

Boneguard Lieutenant.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.

Brave Archer.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

Buccaneer.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
Buccaneer.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

Burgle.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).

Captured Jormungar.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

Charged Hammer.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

Chillmaw.text: Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
Chillmaw.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

Clockwork Knight.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.

Coldarra Drake.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
Coldarra Drake.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

Coliseum Manager.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
Coliseum Manager.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

Competitive Spirit.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.
Competitive Spirit.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.

Confessor Paletress.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

Confuse.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

Convert.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.

Crowd Favorite.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

Cutpurse.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.
Cutpurse.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!

Dalaran Aspirant.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

Dark Bargain.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
Dark Bargain.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

Darnassus Aspirant.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.
Darnassus Aspirant.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!

Demonfuse.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
Demonfuse.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

Draenei Totemcarver.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

Dragonhawk Rider.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

Dreadscale.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.
Dreadscale.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

Dreadsteed.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

Druid of the Saber.text: Choose One - Transform to gain Charge; or +1/+1 and Stealth.
Druid of the Saber.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

Eadric the Pure.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.
Eadric the Pure.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

Effigy.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

Elemental Destruction.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

Enter the Coliseum.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
Enter the Coliseum.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...

Evil Heckler.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

Eydis Darkbane.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

Fallen Hero.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

Fearsome Doomguard.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

Fencing Coach.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
Fencing Coach.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

Fist of Jaraxxus.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.

Fjola Lightbane.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

Flame Juggler.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
Flame Juggler.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"

Flame Lance.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

Frigid Snobold.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

Frost Giant.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
Frost Giant.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

Gadgetzan Jouster.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
Gadgetzan Jouster.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

Garrison Commander.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.
Garrison Commander.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

Gormok the Impaler.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
Gormok the Impaler.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

Grand Crusader.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
Grand Crusader.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

Healing Wave.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.
Healing Wave.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

Holy Champion.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
Holy Champion.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

Ice Rager.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

Icehowl.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

Injured Kvaldir.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

Justicar Trueheart.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
Justicar Trueheart.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

King's Defender.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
King's Defender.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

King's Elekk.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

Knight of the Wild.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
Knight of the Wild.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

Kodorider.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

Kvaldir Raider.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

Lance Carrier.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

Light's Champion.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

Living Roots.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.
Living Roots.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

Lock and Load.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.
Lock and Load.flavor:
Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."
This card pays homage to that special moment.

Magnataur Alpha.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
he attacks.
Magnataur Alpha.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

Maiden of the Lake.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.

Master Jouster.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
Master Jouster.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

Master of Ceremonies.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

Mogor's Champion.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
Mogor's Champion.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.

Mukla's Champion.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

Mulch.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.
Mulch.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.

Murloc Knight.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

Mysterious Challenger.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
Mysterious Challenger.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

Nexus-Champion Saraad.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
Nexus-Champion Saraad.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

North Sea Kraken.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

Orgrimmar Aspirant.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

Pit Fighter.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

Poisoned Blade.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
Poisoned Blade.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.

Polymorph: Boar.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

Power Word: Glory.text:
Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to
your hero.
Power Word: Glory.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

Powershot.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

Ram Wrangler.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.
Ram Wrangler.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

Recruiter.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
Recruiter.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

Refreshment Vendor.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

Rhonin.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

Saboteur.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.
Saboteur.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

Savage Combatant.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.
Savage Combatant.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

Sea Reaver.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
Sea Reaver.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

Seal of Champions.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

Shado-Pan Rider.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

Shadowfiend.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
Shadowfiend.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

Shady Dealer.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.
Shady Dealer.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

Silent Knight.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.

Silver Hand Regent.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

Skycap'n Kragg.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
Skycap'n Kragg.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

Spawn of Shadows.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

Spellslinger.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
Spellslinger.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

Stablemaster.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.
Stablemaster.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

The Mistcaller.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
The Mistcaller.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

The Skeleton Knight.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
The Skeleton Knight.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

Thunder Bluff Valiant.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

Tiny Knight of Evil.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
Tiny Knight of Evil.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

Totem Golem.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

Tournament Attendee.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

Tournament Medic.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

Tuskarr Jouster.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.
Tuskarr Jouster.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

Tuskarr Totemic.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

Twilight Guardian.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
Twilight Guardian.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

Undercity Valiant.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

Varian Wrynn.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
Varian Wrynn.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

Void Crusher.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

Warhorse Trainer.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.
Warhorse Trainer.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.

Wildwalker.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

Wilfred Fizzlebang.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
Wilfred Fizzlebang.flavor:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.
*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

Wrathguard.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
Wrathguard.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

Wyrmrest Agent.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
Wyrmrest Agent.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!
